gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry
Class Tran3D

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry.Tran3D

public class Tran3D
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents basic transformations of Vector3D objects, such as translation, rotation, scaling, 3D viewing & projection, as well as arbitrary 4x4 linear transformations. Methods to apply the transformation to a single Vector3D or an array of Vector3D objects are also provided.

public Tran3D(Tran3D tran)
Construct a copy of the given transformation.

Parameters:
tran - the transformation to copy.

Tran3D

public Tran3D(float[][] matrix)
Construct this transformation using the specified matrix. The matrix must have at least four rows and each of them must have at least four columns.

Parameters:
matrix - the matrix that is to be used for the transform.

Tran3D

public Tran3D(float[] array)
Construct this transformation using the specified list of 16 values.

Parameters:
array - the array of 16 values to be used for this transform in row major order.
Method Detail

equals

public boolean equals(Tran3D tran)
Check whether or not the current transform is exactly the same transformation as the specified transform.

Parameters:
tran - The transform object to compare with the current transform object.
Returns:
Returns true if the current transform object has the same matrix as the specified transform object.

get

public float[][] get()
Set a reference to the 4x4 array containing the matrix for this transformation. return reference to the 4x4 array containing the matrix.

set

public void set(Tran3D tran)
Set this transformation to the specified transformation.

Parameters:
tran - the transformation that the current transform is to be set from.

set

public void set(float[][] matrix)
Set this transformation to the specified matrix. The matrix must have at least three rows and each of them must have at least three columns. In most cases, the matrix should be 4x4. If it is at least 3X3 but not 4x4, then the last row and column will be filled out with the values 0,0,0,1.

Parameters:
matrix - the matrix that is to be used for the transform, padded by 0,0,0,1 in the last row and column, if it is at least 3x3 but not a full 4x4 matrix.

setIdentity

public void setIdentity()
Resets this transform to the identity transform.

setTranslation

public void setTranslation(Vector3D v)
Sets this transform to the transform representing a translation in 3 Dimensions through the homogeneous vector v. It is assumed that v has been "Standardized" so that the 4th component is 1.

Parameters:
v - the homogenous representation of the translation vector { x, y, z, 1 }

setScale

public void setScale(Vector3D v)
Set this transform to the transform representing scaling in 3 Dimensions by the x, y, z components of the homogeneous vector v. It is assumed that v has been "Standardized" so that the 4th component is 1.

Parameters:
v - the homogenous representation of the scaling vector { x, y, z, 1 }

setRotation

public void setRotation(float angle,
                        Vector3D v)
Set this transform to the transform representing rotation in 3 Dimensions through a specified angle about and axis given by the x, y, z components of the homogeneous vector v. It is assumed that v has been "Standardized" so that the 4th component is 1. This function was adapted from "matrix.c" that is part of the Mesa OpenGL code, copyright Brian Paul, 1999-2000. It was contributed to Mesa by Erich Boleyn (erich@uruk.org) and is freely redistributable.

Parameters:
angle - The angle to rotate by, specified in degrees.
v - The homogenous representation of the axis vector { x, y, z, 1 }

transpose

public void transpose()
Set this transform to the transpose of the current ransform.

invert

public boolean invert()
Replace this transformation with it's inverse, if possible.

Returns:
If this transformation was non-singular, it is replaced by by it's inverse and true is returned. Otherwise, false is returned and this transformation is not altered.

setOrientation

public void setOrientation(Vector3D base,
                           Vector3D up,
                           Vector3D translation)
Set this transform to position and orient an object in 3D. An object is assumed to be initially centered at the origin with it's "base" direction in the x direction and it's "up" direction in the y direction. The matrix created by this method will first orient the object so that it's base and up directions are in the directions given by the base and up parameters, and then translate the object by the specified translation. If the base and up vectors are not orthogonal, a new up vector will be calculated that is in the same plane as the original up and base vectors, but is orthogonal to the base vector. If any of the vectors are null, or if the base or up vectors have zero length, or are collinear, then a error message will be printed and the current transformation will not be altered.

Parameters:
base - The direction the x-axis is mapped to.
up - The direction the y-axis is mapped to.
translation - The point the origin is transformed to.

setViewMatrix

public void setViewMatrix(Vector3D cop,
                          Vector3D vrp,
                          Vector3D vuv,
                          boolean perspective)
Set this transform to the transform representing the "view transformation" cooresponding to a specified observers position, orientation and view direction.

Parameters:
cop - The "center of projection", ie. the position of the observer.
vrp - The "view reference point", ie. the point that the observer is looking at.
vuv - The "view up vector", ie. the direction that is "up" for the observer.
perspective - Flag indicating whether or not to make a perspective projection. If false, the projection will be an orthographic projection.

multiply_by

public void multiply_by(Tran3D tran)
Sets this transform to the transform representing the product of itself and the specified transform. Specifically, this = this*tran, so conceptually, the specified transform acts first, followed by the current value of this transform, to get the resulting value for this transform.

Parameters:
tran - the transform that the current transform is to be multiplied by.

apply_to

public void apply_to(Vector3D v1,
                     Vector3D v2)
Multiply the transformation times vector v1, placing the result in vector v2.

Parameters:
v1 - The vector being transformed ( i.e. multiplied by this transform.)
v2 - Set to the result of transforming v1.

apply_to

public void apply_to(Vector3D[] v1,
                     Vector3D[] v2)
Multiply the transformation times each vector in the array v1, placing the result in the corresponding vector in the array v2.

Parameters:
v1 - The array of vectors being transformed ( i.e. multiplied by this transform.)
v2 - Set to the result of transforming the vectors in v1.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Return a string form of this matrix.
